issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
If you build a Titanium app that uses either JSS and/or i18n, then open the Xcode project and build for device, it does not regenerate the stylesheet.plist or i18n lproj directories. The old 2.1.4.GA iOS builder.py does generate the i18n files during the pre-compile phase, but doesn't appear to generate the stylesheet.plist, thus JSS probably didn't work before either.

Need to move those two generation steps into the pre-compile phase. Also double check that this doesn't break anything. There's a bit of an order to which events need to happen.
fields.summary: CLI: iOS: Compiled i18n and JSS files not generated during Xcode builds

comments.body:
To test:

1) create a project with i18n and jss
2) build and run app
3) open up build/iphone/appname.xcodeproj
4) build the app for device from Xcode
5) inspect ~/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/appname-<some guid>/Build/Products/Debug-iphoneos/appname.app
6) notice en.lproj dir is missing
7) notice stylesheet.plist is missing
8) after applying fix
9) rebuild from Xcode
10) notice both en.lproj and stylesheet.plist exist

Verified fixed on:
Mac OS: 10.8.2
Titanium SDK version: 3.0.2.v20130207164659
Titanium Studio, build: 3.0.2.201302041757
CLI version: 3.0.24-cr
Xcode 4.6

en.lproj and stylesheet.plist exist. I also used Espa√±ol, so had an es.lproj as well. Project build in sim, then in Xcode run on device. The app worked as expected.
